content: Investments Stocks Asked by AnonymousAsked on 02 Jun 2019What do you all think of wealthpark? I've heard about Wealthpark as an online platform to invest but i'm still not too sure about it. Anyone tried them before and want to share your experience? Or should i look into other investing platforms?4 answersAnswerBump2
Answers (4)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Eric Ong CfaLevel 5. GeniusAnswered on 14 Aug 2019WealthPark.io is an investing tool for stocks to help you build your wealth.Investing in stocks may be hard at times, but wealthpark.io aims to make investing smarter, faster, easier.
Other than providing financial statements, it has a proprietary analyzer which includes WP Rating, Star Chart, and IV Line. All the features pick up more than 100 data points and provide users a view of the strength and weakness of the company.
Currently, there is a 7-day free trial for users to experience the full features of wealthpark.
You may visit wealthpark.io/blog for a weekly write-up about investing3 comments14

James Yeo, Founder at SmallCapAsia.comLevel 4. ProdigyUpdated on 03 Jun 2019Wealthpark is a product from the VIC Team. It is rather sleek and is an alternative to simplywall.st.Screenshot: https://cl.ly/b05377091f6aWhile you can sign up free, there are many premium features which can only be unlocked via paying an annual membership fee. Here is a breakdown:US$ 120 /year10 years S&P Global Market Intelligence financial informationAccess to Intrinsic Value Line, Wealth Park Rating and Star Chart AnalysisMax. 100 StocksUS$ 365 /year10 years S&P Global Market Intelligence financial informationAccess to Intrinsic Value Line, Wealth Park Rating and Star Chart AnalysisMax. 500 StocksUS$ 1,299 /year10 years S&P Global Market Intelligence financial informationAccess to Intrinsic Value Line, Wealth Park Rating and Star Chart AnalysisMax. 1000 Stocks0 comments2
